definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: It is adopted from the first classic of Mr. Wan Ray-an, a master of new style of martial arts novels.
sentences.chinese: 改编自新派武侠小说名家温瑞安先生的首部经典大作。

sentences.english: The principal of Jinan First Normal School was a New side figure who first adopted schoolbook written in the vernacular.
sentences.chinese: 一师校长是新派人物，首先采用了白话文教科书。

sentences.english: This thesis is trying to study the legal ideas of early reform from macrocosmic and microcosmic point of view.
sentences.chinese: 本文从宏观和微观两方面研究早期维新派的法律思想。

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党的革新派和保守派之间存在严重的分裂。

sentences.english: They stressed the importance of literary translation, too.
sentences.chinese: 此外，维新派还强调对翻译人才的培养。

sentences.english: Leonardo is one of the renovators of the Theology of Freedom.
sentences.chinese: 李奥纳多波夫是一位革新派自由神学家。

sentences.english: He cast his vote for the reformist candidate.
sentences.chinese: 他投票支持革新派的候选人。

sentences.english: The fifth part was a basic summary to the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists.
sentences.chinese: 对戊戌时期维新派领导的不缠足运动的一个基本评析。

sentences.english: This thesis mainly researches the phonetic changes of new Haimen Dialect.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要研究新派海门话的语音变化。

sentences.english: County student members, and Chu Sang camp with a well-known reformers.
sentences.chinese: 县学生员，与朱德裳同为著名维新派人士。

sentences.english: Forty -three percent belonged to the New Breed .
sentences.chinese: 百分之四十三属于新派的类型。

sentences.english: The early reformers used the traditional resources in many aspects.
sentences.chinese: 早期维新派对传统资源的利用包含多个方面。

sentences.english: The decline and death of liberalism.
sentences.chinese: 新派神学的衰落和消亡。

definition: harmonious combination of Chinese and Western elements (idiom)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
